author: Falconhood
title: comes with 7 Droids!!!
review: that is a BAD pic above, the package pic would be better, on the back it shows that it comes with 4 of the white droid, and 3 of the dark-gray droid! the ship is NOT why i bought this, but the pieces make good fodder for other things. The instant army of droids IS why i bought this set. how fun!

author: Pegasi
title: Times Have Changed
review:
I never thought lego would relese a nearly-true army builder.
The vehicles are interesting, because they do conform to the trade federation/ CIS look. The STAP is a great improvement on the previous design in the naboo swamp set, as it looks smooth and swooshable. The battle droid carrier, though not being movie accurate, is a good way to store battle droids without having to risk breaking their hands, and you can get them all off of there quite quickly. 
   Overall, though it is not as good a deal for the beige battle droids as the battle droid carrier, it is good if you want to build up a large seperatist army.

author: Jedd_the_Jedi
title: Excellent Army Builder
review: First of all, I must say I was looking forward to the clone ones more, but this is just excellent! The STAP redesign is low on parts but smart and pretty spiffy. Unfortunately, the droid carrier looks far too thrown together. But the droids included are to die for, plus the new grunge metallic sheen on the super battle droids is one of the best paint jobs I've ever seen. However, it's far too pricey at Singapore $24.95. Still, a great set.

author: omgbrick
title: Finally  a troop builder
review: I'm happy that lego has finally made troop builders something megabloks has been doing for years.First of this set contains seven droids four battle droids and three supers in a new blackish colour which makes them more acuate looking then the former ones from the gunship the stap looks sweet and i personally think its better than the onesfrom 1999.the carrior is nice though it doesn't provide any cover for the troops or supplies on it but its a nice touch overall a great set but there are only two guns for the four battle droiods 5/5 buy two or more and builkd an army.

author: Evilnurn
title: I've been hoping for it all my life
review:
And in days past when my friends and I yearned to stage these battles and we finally can.

This set is the pinnacle of Lego's relationship with Star Wars. It is perfect for collectors, players, builders and diorama makers. It is the perfect balance of minifigure and set, and the price point isn't too bad. Going along with the clone set it is perfect.

My only complaint is that the Super Battle Droid Armor color doesn't match that of the original.

author: david001
title: At long last!
review:
Released along with its siter product #7655 (Clone Battle Pack), this set is designed primarily for those who just want to build up their Droid forces.  The vehicles provided (1 STAP and the carrier pictured above) only appear fleetingly, if at all, in the films but that's not really the point with this set.  

Now if only Lego would release a Stormtrooper battle pack!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Must Have
review:
This is a great set

Pros.
-great army building set
-rerelease of the super battle droids
-transporter for the droids
-new S.T.A.P.
-superbattle droids look better in gray

Cons.
-i would have liked the droids to have their "backpacks"

This is a must for any army and a great set

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Hmmm
review:
Okay. I don't know where I should start to be honest. I’ve collected Lego for many years but now at the age of 15 I'm going for classics to treasure and selling on my old items. And I’ve come across this. It would be a great item to save but I'm still not to sure. 

To be blunt this droid carrier isn’t great. Let’s be fair it lacks good design and Lego initiative!!!!

BUT! And yes its a big but, this is a fantastic army builder and that’s why I will contemplate buying it. 

This model is far worse than the past version and is a classic re-make gone horrifically wrong. This one looks like a slug and is so impractical it’s unreal. But I would be a good buy, just for the droids and lets be fair you can always modify the carrier.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great..... If your only a fan of collecting minifigs
review:
First off who would have ever decided to create an army builder well whoever it was im happy and i bought this set just to see what its like.

Pros:
MiniFigs
Pieces
The New STAP

Cons
The Droid Carrie doesnt really have much to it except the moving swivel peices to let it turn just a little

The Super battle droid legs dont even move theyre big enough to have an extra link in them arnt they?

Overall:

I did like this set got it as a present but it better than what i expected

author: bsmarthen
title: great
review: First off there is nothing wrong with this picture, Its on the box. This set is great. Easy way to make a big battle scene. Could have done with out the tank in exchange for more minifigs. Other than that great set.

author: _add_um
title: Droids droids and more droids!!
review:
*Review was revised on the 16th of December 2013*

Awsome set. This one of the first two Battle Packs released back in 2007. It notably had Super Battle Droids which hadn't been in sets for a while (of course now they're in plently of sets). 

Box/Instructions

The design of the box and instructions are nice. It's my favourite box art used for any of Star Wars set even now in 2013. The box art includes the 30th anniversary of Star Wars logo too. One thing that bugged me is on the back of the box it shows four blasters for the Battle Droid but only two are included. 

Parts

Not many unique parts are included but a nice selection of parts. Lots of brown parts which are handy.

Minifigures

A total of seven minifigures are in included: four Battle Droids (with the horizontal hands) and three Super Battle Droids. Only two Battle Droids are armed. The droids themselves are fairly common but are still great to collect even now. It should be noted this is the last ever set to have the "megaphone blasters". In 2007 the new blaster molds were introduced and this set could be seen as a send-off to lego's old design for blasters because they didn't produce the new arms for droids as of yet. Of course it would be phased out later that year when Battle Droids were given these new arms to hold the new guns. The Super Battle Droids are of course the highlight of this set. They haven't been seen since 2002 and even then they only appeared once in blue (in set 7163). Finally they return in a more accurate look with a gun metal/silver colour. 

The build

The build is not complex at all and can be completed in about ten minutes or less. 

The completed model

Overall the finished model is great. Battle Pack of course are all about the figures and not the model itself but the two vehicles are nice. Firstly the STAP bike is great, I love the transparent stand used to give it the illusion it's hovering or flying. It's also lego's best version of the STAP because lego for some reason have since then made the stand for the feet too wide with those wings parts for them. The Droid Transport is nice but very flimsy. The Droids simply just stand on the back while the driver fit in the front. It should be noted lego completely made this vehicle up, thought it's similar to the Battle Droid Carrier . 

Summary

A great battle pack with the long awaited return of Super Battle Droids.

author: Redbullgivesuwind
title: At last i can wipe out those pesky jedi!
review: I really like this set and its a great way to build up our army. and after 3 sets you have two units one of battle and one super battle droid. The droid carrer has no real place and it would have been better to have another STAAP or something else but other than that you can't complain especially for 8.99

author: reidak49
title: cool
review: nice set you get 7 droids 4 battle droids and 3 super battle droids a stap can land on the carrier ( witch is not movie accurate ) and a con is the pilot should have blue markings on its head and combind it with a mtt you got a army

author: sith_assassin

review: 7 droids!                                                             Pros:                                                               7 droids                                                              super battle droids                                                              Lightsaber hilts                                                               S.T.A.P                                                             Cons:                                                               None!

author: mrmitch
title: The Dark Side needs these Droids
review: Set is good value, 7 Droids are included in this Droid Battle Pack. The set is affordable and is Quick to build a must for any Star Wars LEGO collection. It would make a great gift for a child, even if they have the set it could add to thier growing army. Strongly recommend this set to everyone, even if you are a casual Star Wars collector such as myself.

It goes great with my MTT (the new one).

author: legoguysw
title: Small but cool
review:
Army builder sets: what a great idea! This is the first year of them, so some flaws have to be accepted.
Pro's:
Super battle droids.
Battle droids.
STAP: A bit fragile, but none the less a nice addition
New Droid vehicle: Again, a bit fragile but has a nice design. Droids can be transported on it. Room for blasters as well.
Fun to battle against Clone battle pack.
Turret for droid to stand in.

Con’s:
Hard to get droid into turret
Droids don’t stand in vehicle well
Overall design of  droid carrier needs re thinking.

This set is okay. Needs some improvements, and would go well with an MTT.

author: millacol88
title: Droids battle pack does not disappoint
review:
This set is awesome. Not only does it come with 4 regular battle droids, it also comes with three super battle droids, an awesome troop carrier and a simple but elegant STAP. This, combined with a clone battle pack, creates a pretty great battle scene. I currently only have one however I am planning on buying one more for my battle of Kashyyyk. There are two bad things about this set,though: The trooper's guns are simply megaphones with one by one circular translucent orange plates on the end. Since this set came out after the new molded guns came out, why didn't they just use them? Also, the way the droid's arms are made it makes them hold the guns sideways.

Pros:
-seven droids total
-troop carrier and STAP
-a cheap way to get droids

Cons:
-arms make the droids hold their guns sideways
-megaphones, not the new molded guns.

In short if you are a star wars fan, buy this set. Well, you probably already have.

author: Leggodt94
title: Much better, LEGO!
review: This set I would have to say is much better than the clone battle pack mainly because it comes with more minifigs. Not only that but this set also features a rare stap vehicle(with clear-piece stand), droid carrier vehicle(with adjustable guns) and it comes with supers(not many sets do)! Another thing that seems obvious is that this set is also inexpensive. With that said, I think that this set definitely belongs at the top of all the battle pack sets.

author: smiley905
title: very cool
review: this is a realy good set, the stap is my favorite part and its realy detailed and is pretty stable. the carrier i dont like, i dont think you ever see one on the movie, and it doesnt llok that great, the back is dumb, but the fron and the guns are pretty cool. the droids are cool, especialy the super battle droids which are taller and have diffrent peices than the battle droids. the guns on the battle droids are the old ones but theyre not that bad. it has 7 droids in total and the clone trooper pack has 4, but these are cheeper to make so if this one came with four it would be a rip off, and if the other one came with seven lego wouldnt be making money. this is a good set and is fun to play with, i just dont like the droid carrier.

author: Gus_263
title: Heping to make an army
review: This is a batllepack, including some droids, 4 battle droids and 3 super battle droids, with different pieces comparing with normal minifigures. The vehicles are too useful to armies and battle scenes, some including light sabers' bases. The battle droids are smaller than the super battle droids. The weapons of the droids looks like shooter weapons but shoots nothing. This have more pieces than the clone troopers battle pack, and is more easy make an army with droids.

author: arctrooper170
title: A good set for 10 bucks!
review:
The droids battle pack is a pretty good, it doesnt have much but it comes with 7 droids! When it first came out it had a special value in a lego magizine, so I bought 4 and saved $5.
now heres the pros and cons

PROS:
comes with 7 droids (4 battle droids and 3 super battle droids)
the STAP bike is pretty good for only a few pieces (did you see the new one that comes with the AT-TE walker)
the carrier is stable and doesnt take up to much room and it can carry all 7 droids

CONS:
the guns are still megaphones (the AT-ST has a new pistol)
should have new arms like the MTT

author: lego12
title: *Roger*  *Roger*   Great set for $9.99!
review:
When I was going to buy this set I was deciding whether to buy this or the Indiana Jones tent set....and I chose this, and it was a GREAT choice!  It has four normal droids and three super battle droids.  It DOES come with four guns for every droid, unlike people had said before me.  It has a STAP for a droid and a droid carrier that is NOT accurate to the movie, but that is NOT a big deal AT ALL!
  
    If you are interested in MORE lightsaber handles this comes with FOUR of them for the STAP and the droid carrier. The droid carrier fits ALL of the super battle droids and ALL of the normal droids at once.  It comes with a seethrough Lego stand for the STAP to make it look more realistic and in MY opinion it was a GREAT idea of Lego to make a Lego stand for the STAP!
  
    It is a GREAT addition to the Clone Turbo Tank, if you have it, or for ANY other set that has ANY clones in it!  I would HIGHLY recommend this set to ANYBODY!  I am even thinking of buying another droid battle pack to make an even BIGGER battle!  Thanks for reading my review of set #7654: Droid Battle Pack and I hope you enjoyed it!
            Lego12

author: Obi_Wan9994
title: Affordable and Fun!
review:
I got this set when it came out, and it exceeded my expectations.

Pros:
4 Battle droids
3 Super Battle Droids
Droid carrier. Spots for all but one Battle droid. Holds the Blaster Rifles. Neat looking and cool cockpit for 1 Battle Droid(moves left to right). Cool looking guns on the front(moves up and down). Sturdy. Good pieces. Small easy to transport. Good playability
STAP. Nice design. Pretty sturdy. good pieces. Fantastic Playability.
Cheap.
Goes great with the clone battle pack. They're so fun to re-enact battles with.
Fast, easy to build

Cons:
I think the carrier should have a bit better design. It just looks kind of awkward, but you know, I don't care too much, it's still a great set.
I think that that the blaster rifles should have been upgraded to the new detailed versions.

I recommend this to any Lego and/or Star Wars fan.

Enjoy!

The troopers' battle pack is slightly superior to this one, but only because its speeder isn't poorly built like the droid carrier here. Also, the set is so generic that it's impossible to tell what movie it's from. In conclusion, buy this set if you need some spare minifigs, but if not, don't, because all it does is take up space.

This is a great set; I love how Lego gave us a true army builder. The amount of droids is right; the vehicles are right, but... What about the arms? Every other MODREN droid set the arms with different direction hands, and the cool new blasters. That’s what kept me away from the droids before, were these UGLY gun they hade. To ad insult to injury, this set came like 3 weeks before the MTT, which has the new droid arms. However, this is easily fixed by going to BickLink, just buy however many arms and new blasters, or use your own. Still a great set, good amount of figs and vehicles, I highly recommend it, even though it's out of production. I plan on getting about 6 more for my droid army.

author: legoclone
title: Warning - defect (i think) in the arms.
review: First off this kit is a good one to build up your droid army and the little vehicle is kind of cool and at the very least makes for some good spare parts.  I love the STAP.  I just wish the battle droids has been the newer ones that had one wrist turned so they could hold a blaster correctly (and this set comes with “megaphone blasters”).   The defect is with the super battle droids arms – apparently the arm peg is a little to big for the arm socket.  You’ll notice it’s a tight fit when you put the arm on.  I have had 3 arms break in different sets.  They weren’t dropped or played with but the arms just developed a crack and eventually broke around the arm socket.   I have since taken a small jewelers file and shaved down the arm peg’s diameters a little (I was afraid to increase the arm sockets diameter because that is where the break is occurring).   I can only hope that Lego has addressed this issue with the new super battle droids(?)

author: Alemas
title: "Roger roger!"

This is a great way of getting a good supply of battle droids and super battle droids! It has a swivelling turret(makes me think of a Dalek), a place for the droids, and lots of guns!

Old "megaphone blasters": the Clone Battle pack gets the new versions

Overall, a great set!

Overall good enough to get a 3, notbad really...

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Droids Battle Pack
review:
The Droids Battle Pack set (7654) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2007. It comes with 7 minifigs and 102 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7654-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

Battle Droids: The Battle Droids are nothing special. They have the tan color and they have the old LEGO Star Wars blasters with the megaphone and the transparent orange stud.

Super Battle Droids:  There's also noting special about the Super Battle Droids. They have the 'muscles' and the basic metal look.

STAP:

The STAP is attached to some clear bricks. The color for the STAP is brown and we got the lightsaber handles for the blaster. The droid can be put on the STAP very nicely. There's also a megaphone piece on each side for the engine.

Speeder Bike:

The speeder bike is very simple. On the front you can find a place to put on the droid which controls the speeder. Behind the cockpit you can see the megaphone blasters. On each side you can see some turrets which do sviwel up and down. 5 droids can stay on the speeder behind the megaphone blasters.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Great army builder
No stickers

Negative:

Not so many play features
Too easy to build

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

author: Chilli96
title: 7 Droids!
review:
This set has seven droids which isn't fair against the Clone Trooper Battle Pack which only has four Clones!

Pros:
 - Brown STAP
 - Battle Droid Carrier
 - Four Battle Droids
 - Three Super Battle Droids
 - Round bumps on bottom of Carrier
 - Spinning Turret
 - STAP's Invisible Stand
 - Bigger than most £10 nowadays

Cons:
 - Old Megaphone Blasters

author: bobbythefish123
title: greatest battle pack ever
review:
this is the greatest battle pack ever. I bought the landing craft and the y-wing fighter while this was out, and i wish i had just spent that money on 9 of . It included 7 droids. 4 battle droids and 3 super battle droids. It also had a nice carrier vehicle and a small speeded called a STAP.

The carrier holds the figures very well and it is easy to remove them. It goes well with the clone battle pack and makes an excellent droid army builder.

Overall on minifigs and vehicles, 11/10

BEST SET OUT THERE AS FAR AS VALUE FOR MONEY

author: CommanderFanta
title: One Of The Best (If Not The Best) Battle Pack Ever!
review:
When My Mum Brought Me To My Local Art & Hobby's Back In 2007, As Soon As I Saw This Set I Was In Awe. My First Reaction Was: "Super Battle Droids!" Because This Was The First Time We Had Seen These Guys Since The Gunship Way Back In 2002. It Was Also The Very First Time We Had Seen Them In a Gunmetal Colour And Not That Strange Cobalt Blue. As Well As The Fact That You Get Four Battle Droids To Compliment The Super Battle Droids. You Get Two Vehicles! A Very Nice STAP, (A Big Improvement On The One From 1999, And In My Opinion Better Than The One That Came With The AT-TE, Too)  As Well As A Tank That Looks Similar To The TF Patrol Boat That Appeared In "Star Wars: Starfighter" (Click On The LInk Below For The Picture Of The Patrol Boat) Anyway, Onto The Pros And Cons:

 

Pros:

Seven Droids!

Super Battle Droids

STAP!

Cheap!

 

Cons:

Super Battle Droid Arms VERY (And I Mean VERY) Fragile

 

Other Than The Fact That The Super Battle Droid Arms Are Very Fragile, This Is An Excellent Set, I Highly Recommend It,

 

Seeya,

 

Commander Coca-Cola

 

P.S Link For The TF Patrol Boat:

http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Trade_Federation_Patrol_Boat

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Droids are transported to battle (BATTLE DROIDS, that is)...
review:
This is one of those Star Wars sets where a 6-year-old would say: Hey look, mommy! I WANT THAT SET! This is because it is a very good one, especially for the price! You get alot of Battle Droids (And Super Battle Droids), plus a STAP (The non-blue one, this one looks more realistic). Here are some Pros and Cons to sum this set:

Pros:
1. Good Price for amount of droids
2. Goes well with Clones Battle Pack
3. STAP is also very good and detailed, with a piece to keep it looking as if it is hovering
4. Transport can hold about 4 droids

Cons:
1. AHHH! The old blasters! NOOOOOOO
2. Challenging to put the pilot into the transport
3. Droids don't always stay in Transport

I give this a 4/5, if not a 3.5/5. Nothing bad about the set itself, just a few annoying things that LEGO does sometimes. Parents, your child will like this and will probably be able to build it by themselves (However putting the pilot in and droids may be tricky for them)

Hope this review helps! I recommend this set WITH the Clones Battle Pack if you can get it!

author: NickBrick
title: second best star wars set I ever got
review:
I think Ill just pros and cons this time.

                                              Pros.
 
                                      most guys ever in a battle pack.7

                                     cool redesign of stap

                                    brown pieces
 
                                        super battle driods

                                       old guns[you know the ones that are really mega phones.

                                        Cons.

                                 this is"nt really for the set but for brickset's picture it does'nt show everything.

                                  overall awesome cheap set.

author: spacewars30
title: My First Review
review:
It is a pretty good set. It has seven droids: 4 battle droids and 3 super battle droids. I think it could be a little cheaper, but it's still a decent price. It was easy to build, and it's a great start to a droid army!

 

Pros:

4 Battle Droids

3 Super Battle Droids

Easy to build

 

Cons:

Could be a little cheaper

Should have made carrier bigger

author: FloridaEggplant
title: Army Builder
review: This set is really small so no Pros/Cons list. This set isn't really the greatest army builder, but hey, its one of the first battle packs (AKA army builders) by Lego. The STAP is good. Its kinda a waste of time trying to put a droid into the cockpit tube thingy, he will fall in a lot, its like falling in the toilet. The new super battle droids leg joints break alot, and it cant be fixed. If you try using glue (Hot glue gun ext), it wont work because it would be hard to get it accurate, so that the torso fits. I don't recommend this set to anyone (collectors, young people, people who still play with it).

author: PaulTR
title: These Are the Droids You're Looking For!
review:
I didn't really know about this set until my parents bought it for me a few years ago. After building it and playing with it for years, I found this set to be one of the best battle packs released.

 

The 7654 is a decent set as far as looks go. The armored vehicle looks rather simplistic, and is not SW canon, but this fact can be forgiven, as it does look like something the CIS would deploy. The STAP vehicle is a nicely constructed little addition; I was very pleased with its appearence, as it does closely follow the movie. The brown coloring for both vehicles looks good, although it may be at odds with the grey/bluish coloring of newer CIS LEGO sets. Overall, I thought the set as a whole looked decent, if a bit too simple; then again, this is set is marketed as an army builder, not really a "paegent queen" set.

 

The construction of the set was quick and simple. The main vehicle is very simply made, with sloped brown pieces comprising the back half, and a turntable piece with a small turret taking up the front. The STAP vehicle, in my opinion, is a bit more interesting: A clear piece supports the vehicle, while a droid pilots it with only his hands attached to a small hinge piece; his feet then rest on a piece using the SNOT (Studs Not On Top) technique facing towards the rear. It's a very clever little design, and probably my favorite part of the set, outside of the droids. As far as pieces go, you don't get many new items: Brown sloped pieces, some grey platforms, battle droid parts, and a few clear pieces. However, with that being said, you do get 7 battle droids (4 regular, 3 super), which is more minifigs than any other battle pack set. Also, you do get a good amount of useful lightsaber pieces in grey, a few multi-colored megaphones (you can never have enough of those!), and a very handy dark grey ring-piece from the front of the armored vehicle. So, while most of the pieces are rather normal, there are a few goodies within the box.

 

The playability of this set is very low, although it is higher than the other battle packs. You can turn the turret on the vehicle, angle the guns, load up your droids, and even skid the smooth-bottomed repulsor craft across a table. As a side note, it's fun to play "Droid bowling" with the repulsor craft and the droids, with the hard-to hit STAP acting as bonus points (Hey! Don't give me weird looks! I'm still a kid at heart, okay?) The droids themselves, which are the main draw of the set, are your typical droid figs with megaphone blasters; some may find the megaphone blasters and the droid's lack of "straight" arms annoying, as more recent droids use LEGO blasters and "straight" arms to hold them; however, this set was made before those pieces came out, so you can't really blame TLG. Personally, I'm not bothered by it, as someone's gotta drive the STAP :) The super battle droids are definitely the stars of this set: The figs look great, and their specialized arms and legs open up all sorts of possibillities for hybrid droids. The price per piece ratio is also fair, at $10 US dollars for 102 pieces; indeed, it has the most pieces out of any battle pack set, so at least you're not getting cheated out of your hard-earned cash. Now, on to the list!

Pros:

  • -Useful vehicles
  • -STAP cleverly designed
  • -More figs than other battle packs (although they are ubiquitous droids)
  • -Affordable
  • -Useful pieces, such as lightsabers in grey

Cons:

  • -Armored vehicle extremly simple to build
  • -Hardly any new pieces
  • -Not many "play" features

In the end, this set is a fantastic army builder. The sheer amount of droids that are included, the STAP vehicle, and the affordable price are the set's best points; indeed, I consider this one of the best battle packs LEGO has released! While I would have liked to see a few special guns or maybe a pair of Droidekas in place of the repulsor vehicle, I still think this is a great little set. I would highly recommend it for both SW fans and army builders. Who knows? These just might be the droids you're looking for ;)

author: Odeinoichus
title: Separatist Armies Rise!
review:
Set #7654 Droids Battle Pack: The first official pair of Battle Packs were appropriately chosen by LEGO. This set and the Clone Troopers Battle Pack are really what troop building LEGO Mini-Figures is all about.

 

Cheap sets that offer up a certain number of Mini-Figures for your Separatist Armies is basically what the Battle Packs are. (Or Rebel/Imperial/Republic Armies depending on the Mini-Figures.) This Battle Pack was a hot ticket item when it first came out perhaps more so than the Clones because of the sheer number of Mini-Figures included with it.

 

What do you get to build in this set? One small sized Droid Carrier, one STAP and of course the Battle Droids and Super Battle Droids. You get 7 Mini-Figures in this set, four regular Battle Droids and three Super Battle Droids. The Droid Carrier is built fairly nicely, but the STAP was a really great new take on the build and I enjoyed it a little more than the Droid Carrier. Although the Droid Carrier gets a few extra points for not using the old rod style of transport for the Battle Droids.

 

The Battle Droids were given the older style Space themed blasters, two extra for the pilots, and they didn't yet include the straight arm for holding the blasters properly, but depending on how many sets you do buy from year to year that includes Battle Droids you could potentially have enough spares to replace some of the arms on these ones.

 

The Super Battle Droids are a much nicer colored plastic compared to the lighter blue of the first iteration. These ones have a more mechanical looking and smoother tone appearance due to the nature of the colors chosen in their casting.

 

I picked up 3 of this Battle Pack and I was not dissapointed, had I been able to get 4 of them as I originally planned I think it would look even more impressive on display with the four STAPs flanking the four Droid Carriers. Overall I recommend this set to anyone who enjoys Troop Building cheaply. True it isn't widely available these days, but it is a set that you can't pass up, everyone should own at least one of this set for their collection to enhance their Droid Armies display.

author: reidak12
title: Roger Roger
review:
This was the first Star Wars set I got, along with the clone trooper battle back. It is much better than the clone battle pack, and it is the only battle pack so far than is actually any good for building an army. The STAP is pretty cool, and as long as you don't put the battle droids in the carrier, it is pretty cool.

 

Pros:

good army builder

improved STAP

super battle droids [not that common]

Cons:

battle droids have the old arms

they look stupid standing up in the transport

 

Overall, this set is no great addition to a collection, except as an army builder.

author: legokun
title: Droids!
review: I bought this set for one reason and one reason only: battle droid mini-figs. Based on the amount you get for such a low price, i'd say that it is extremely worth it. With 4 battle droids and 3 super battle droids in the small and simple set, along with a droid carrier, the droid battle pack's purpose matches its title. Buy this set, and you will have got what you wanted if you asked for a droid set at a reasonable price.

author: psychman7
title: Star Wars Set #1: 7654 Droids Battle Pack
review:
This was the very first Star Wars set I got. It was a nice start to my collection, and I got a hunk-load of battle droids!

Box/Instructions:
Very nice box detailing, showing everything in the set and noting how it's an army builder. The instructions are nice and simple, and are easy enough to comprehend.

The Pieces:
Fairly good choice of pieces, even if only a third of the number of pieces in this set belong to the battle droids and super battle droids. Not a bad thing, though.

The Minifigures:
This set contains four battle droids and three super battle droids. Seeing as this was my very first Star Wars set which I got back in 2007, a bunch of battle droids seemed like a good way to get started. The battle droids are pretty cool, and they make super good army builders. The super battle droids are very impressively detailed, and look much better in the titanium metallic color than the metallic sand grey. They also make good army builders, and I find it hard to keep track of how many of those and battle droids I have now.

The STAP:
Not bad for a 2007 version. It's a little stunted compared to the movie version, methinks, but it's pretty good. The 2012 version (which I do not have) is a whole lot better.

The Troop Carrier:
Even though this vehicle didn't show up in the movies, it carries three battle droids (including the pilot) and all three super battle droids. The rotating cockpit is kind of an interesting idea, and the guns look okay, but it also makes a good army builder.

The Final Verdict:
Pieces - 9/10 - Good picks and interesting techniques.
Minifigures - 10/10 - Always good to have multiple droids (especially a whopping 7) in one set.
STAP - 8/10 - Could've been a better design, but good enough.
Troop Carrier - 8/10 - An interesting choice, but it was not in any of the films.

Final result - 8.75/10. Overall a very good set for a collection starter.

author: Spartan022
title: One of the Best Battle Packs
review: The Droid Battle Pack remains to be one of the best Battle Pack sets ever released. Having 7 figures which include 3 Super Battle droids is amazing, and great value for money. The STAP is designed simply but well, and stands well on its own with a plastic base. The Troop Carrier itself leaves a bit to be desired, buts its design allows for a droid to sit nicely in the cockpit, and for two blasters to be stored in it. The Troop Carrier can easily fit all of the Super Battle Droids and Battle Droids too, (assuming one is on the STAP and one is in the cockpit). Overall its a great set and contains great figures and great playability possibilities.

author: DancingDinosaurs
title: One of the Best!
review:
People like to rag on modern battle packs. They complain about the lack of "true army builders", as most battle packs now have 1 or 2 of the minifig slots taken up by officers or other unwanted/unnecessary officers and such. Of course, they are correct. The new battle packs absolutely do deserve criticisms. However, it saddens me to see people romanticize the "days of old" yet look past this battle pack.

 

The set came out along with 7655 back in 2007. Being the first battle packs, LEGO sure did start off strong. Both sets were incredible, and both had great figures. To make up for the droids being "cheap" in the eyes of fans, they included 4 B1 Battle Droids, and 3 B2 Battle droids. This was truly a droid army builder's dream! 7 droid figures for the price of $9.99! Why not pick it up? It was truly a hidden gem among Star Wars sets as a whole. 

Perhaps some day, people will look back and see it's true beauty.

 

Pros

- Good number of figures

- Fun vehicles

- Was a great way to get B2 Super Battle Droids

 

Cons 

- B1 Battle Droids have 2 curved arms, unfortunate, as the straight arms were released the following year. 

- Though the vehicles are fun, the build may be boring to some.

author: Captainfives1514
title: One of many
review:
I got this set in a bucket of LEGOs for Christmas back in 2013. I built it rather quickly but realized I was missing the super battle droids for this set. I was able to get some super battle droids later to complete the minifigure selection in the set.

 Minifigures

 B-1 Battle Droid. You get four standard battle droids same as the ones they make now except that they're blaster arm isn't rotated eighty degrees. They carry the old megaphone blasters

 B-2 Battle Droid. You also get four super battle droid In gunmetal grey. They are the same ones that have been made for years. LEGO appears to have discontinued making them however and these droids are beginning to command a high price on the aftermarket.

 The Build 

 First you build a STAP for one of the B-1 battle droids to ride on. Then you build the troop carrier. There are no moving parts or interesting pieces.

 Overall 

This is one of the sets that started the battle pack era. It's a great army builder and an excellent source for battle droids. I wish LEGO would go back to making two battle packs a year with opposing forces to choose from. This is a great set and if you can find it I would highly recommend adding it to your collection.
